subject: On your passage calculus
key_passage: I have studied your reduction rules with great interest. Might there be a simpler foundation?

subject: Re: On your passage calculus
key_passage: The three forms (variable/abstraction/application) are minimal. What would you remove?

subject: The burden of names
key_passage: Names require bookkeeping - alpha conversion/capture avoidance. What if we eliminated them entirely?

subject: On your combinatory proposal
key_passage: Your S/K primitives intrigue me but seem to obscure meaning. How would you express SUCC?

subject: Three primitives suffice
key_passage: I can now prove: any Î»-term has an equivalent SKI form. The algorithm is mechanical.

subject: Re: Three primitives
key_passage: Mechanical translation is not understanding. Your S(S(KS)K)(S(KS)K) for TWICE conveys nothing.

subject: On the necessity of names
key_passage: For the debate: I maintain that names track identity. Your combinators lose the thread of meaning.

subject: Re: On the necessity of names
key_passage: Identity is preserved in structure not symbols. The same reduction occurs with or without labels.

subject: The S combinator fully characterized
key_passage: S distributes/duplicates. It is the source of all computational power in my system.

subject: On Three Primitives Suffice
key_passage: I have read your treatise. The mathematics is sound. But you have built a desert and called it paradise.

subject: On your appointment
key_passage: Welcome to the Archives officially. Our disagreements have sharpened both our thinking.

subject: On the Legibility Critique
key_passage: Gast misunderstands. Legibility is learned not inherent. Once trained combinators become clear.

subject: Re: On the Legibility Critique
key_passage: Gast has a point. But I think you also have one. Perhaps there are contexts for each notation.

subject: New combinators B and C
key_passage: I concede something to the critics: B and C improve readability without losing purity.

subject: The bird taxonomy
key_passage: I have given them names after all - Mockingbird/Kestrel/Starling. Perhaps you were right about labels.

subject: Re: The bird taxonomy
key_passage: Ha! Names return through the back door. But I see your point - these are mnemonic not semantic.

subject: Y in pure combinators
key_passage: I have derived your fixed point in my notation. We arrive at the same place by different paths.

subject: Re: Y in pure combinators
key_passage: A beautiful result. The Y combinator cares not whether it wears names or not.

subject: On your retirement
key_passage: After 72 years you leave the formal work. But the work leaves no one. It continues in us.

subject: Re: On your retirement
key_passage: The work continues indeed. I watch it from a distance now. You carry it forward.

subject: On the passing of Kelleth Mund
key_passage: We disagreed on everything except what mattered: that structure underlies transformation and understanding requires precision.
